Which of the following clauses in an
outsourcing contract helps improve the level of
use latest operating system and hardware
provision of training to outsourced staff

What is the most important function that IS management
performs in such situations where an organization has
outsourced some of its IS processes?
ensure that chargs are paid per the SLA
provide training for the outsourced staff
ensure that chargs are paid per the SLA

noticed that outsourcing vendors were appointed without
obtain feedback about service provider from the wider industry

ensure that formal contracts are in place
obtain feedback about service provider from the wider industry
setup a framework to monitor and control the service
ensure that formal contracts are in place
Which of the following is the primary benefit of outsourcing
reliance can be placed on the expertise of outsourcing vendors
more control can be exercised over the IT process
Organizations can pass on their responsibilities
reliance can be placed on the expertise of outsourcing vendors
Which of the following cannot be outsourced?
benchmarking security policies with other orgs in the industry
developing IT security policy awareness among users
A major concern when outsourcing IT support services to a
provider in another country is which of the following?
delay in service delivery due to time differences
difficult to monitor because of geographic distance

types of hardware to be used
employee training policies to be implemented
types of hardware to be used

to a provider in another country is which of the following?
privacy laws prevent the flow of info across borders
privacy laws prevent the flow of info across borders

details about the business continuity plan (BCP)

number of incidents solved in the first call
